info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 1:14AM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
At 114 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Stanley to near Rowley. Movement was northeast at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and minor flooding.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Strong winds could break tree limbs, knock down weak trees and blow around unsecured objects. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding.
Locations impacted include... Independence, Manchester, Winthrop, Hazleton, Quasqueton, Lamont, Brandon, Rowley, Aurora, Dundee, Masonville, Stanley, Wapsipinicon Golf Course, Manchester Airport, Fontana County Park, Otterville, Jakway Park, Lime Creek County Park, Winthrop Golf Course, and Delaware County Fairgrounds.
This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 50 and 53.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed.

parameter.value: Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Buchanan and northwestern Delaware Counties through 215 AM CDT
